Pill

Use the pill component to visualize keywords (filters or tags).

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-pill

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-pill

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-pill/src/scss/pill";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Pill

Add the .vl-pill class to an element, preferably a <span>.

Optie 1 
      <span class="vl-pill">
    Optie 1
  </span>

Pill success

Use the success variant by adding the .vl-pill--success class to display a green color.

Beschikbaar 
      <span class="vl-pill vl-pill--success">
    Beschikbaar
  </span>

Pill warning

Use the warning variant by adding the .vl-pill--warning class to display an orange color.

Bijna volzet 
      <span class="vl-pill vl-pill--warning">
    Bijna volzet
  </span>

Pill error

Use the error variant by adding the .vl-pill--error class to display a red color.

Volzet 
      <span class="vl-pill vl-pill--error">
    Volzet
  </span>

Pill clickable

Use the clickable pill variant to allow the user to click a tag. You can use this variant to filter items in a list, for example. Add the .vl-pill--clickable class to add the visual hint that the element is clickable.

      
  <button class="vl-pill vl-pill--clickable" type="button">
    Optie 1
  </button>

Pill closable

Use the closable pill variant to allow the user to delete a tag. You can use this variant to delete a filter, for example. Add the .vl-pill--closable class and add the button with the .vl-pill__close class. Refer to the example for best practices.

Optie 1 
      <div class="vl-pill vl-pill--closable">
    <span>Optie 1</span>
    <button class="vl-pill__close" type="button">
      <span class="vl-u-visually-hidden">Verwijderen</span>
    </button>
  </div>

Pill checkable

Use the checkable pill variant to allow the user to select of deselect a tag. You can use this variant to indicate which filter is active, for example. Add the .vl-pill--checkable class in combination with <label> and <input> (and an empty span), for visual styling.

      <label class="vl-pill vl-pill--checkable" for="option-1">
    <input class="vl-pill--checkable__checkbox" type="checkbox" id="option-1" name="option-1" value="1" />
    <span></span> Optie 1
  </label>

Accessibility

When using the closable pill variant, it is recommended to be specific in the hidden text so that screenreader users (class="vl-u-visually-hidden") know what the pill closes. "Close registration dialog" is more meaningful than just "Close". When using the error, warning or success variant, make sure the meaning of the variant (error, warning or success) is also available in text. Never rely on color alone to make the meaning explicit.
